snippet: On MSNBC’s “Morning Joe,” Mayor Bill de Blasio faced pointed questions about his stance on New York charter schools and conceded that his public-relations efforts had to improve.
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio faces pointed questions during MSNBC Morning Joe interview about his stance on New York City charter schools and concedes that his public-relations efforts have to improve; he later makes a surprise appearance at a meeting of a group of charter school executives who had been invited to City Hall, speaking for more than 45 minutes about his approach to education.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: On MSNBC’s “Morning Joe,” Mayor Bill de Blasio faced pointed questions about his stance on New York charter schools and conceded that his public-relations efforts had to improve.

headline.main: Tense Moments in de Blasio’s TV Interview
headline.print_headline: Tense Moments in Mayor’s TV Interview
